result.execSummary:
The defendant Norman Gregory Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: This judgment is for fines, court costs and restitution that you were ordered to pay through Dept of Corrections - if not paid during probation - or you get revoked  and have not paid in full - you will be required to pay to the Clerk of Courts any unpaid amount plus interest.

miscConds.notes: Fine $379.00   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

DNA surcharge $200.00   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Not to consume any alcohol - absolute sobriety

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Norman Gregory Miller

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Norman Gregory Miller in court with attorney James C. McLaughlin.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  10:02 AM  Court calls case and recites appearances.  Also has 15 CM 246.  State recites plea 15 CM 246 plead to Misd. bail jump and 15 CM 227 DRI - probation 1 year AODA - absolute sobriety - $579.00 including costs.  Atty MCL agrees.  Defendant agrees.  Court questions defendant re: plea questionnaire.  Defendant entered plea of NC.  Court finds defendant guilty and 15 CM 227 is dismissed and read-in.  State argues sentencing.  Atty McL argues sentencing.

COURT:  Sentence w/held probation 1 year - fine plus costs $579.00 - absolute sobriety - AODA and any follow thru -

No abusive Contact with  -  Sherri Sibila
Statutory Minimum Domestic Abuse Bail Conditions
As a condition of my release from custody in this matter, I agree that I will not engage in any threats or acts of domestic abuse against the victim "Sherri Sibila" or any other person.
I understand that "domestic abuse" means:
Intentional infliction of physical pain, injury or illness.
Intentional impairment of physical condition. 
First, second or third degree sexual assault.  
A physical act that may cause the other person reason to fear imminent engagement in the conduct described above, including but not limited to the intentional destruction of physical property.
